alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 21 at 2:06PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...GUSTY EAST WINDS AND FRIGID WIND CHILLS ACROSS SIERRA RIDGETOPS SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY... SIERRA RIDGETOP WINDS: * An incoming cold front will begin to increase Sierra ridgetop winds tonight with peak gusts of 60-80 mph possible out of the northwest. Winds will then shift northeast to east behind the cold front Sunday morning. * Strong and gusty east winds on Sunday could push Sierra crest gusts up to 100-120 mph while gusts along the Carson Range reach near 80 mph. Gusty winds could also develop across Lake Tahoe Sunday into Monday with easterly gusts of 30-40 mph with choppy lake waters possible, particularly across western shores. EXPOSED RIDGETOP WIND CHILLS: * A cold front sweeps through Sunday morning, which combined with strong ridgetop winds, could introduce hazardous wind chills (-15 to -25F) for high elevation exposed ridgetops along the Sierra crest. * Be sure to be cognizant of the wind and wind chills if you have outdoor recreation plans in the high Sierra through Monday. Otherwise, expect increased high clouds in the morning with a stray flurry across the Sierra possible Sunday morning.
